page.title: 12THE SPRUISTIES
page.content: The{Spruisties}take up the largest area of farmland in Killinghall. They lie to the east of the village and embrace the farms of Spruisty Grange, Spruisty Hall, Little Spruisty, and Spruisty Hill. They are owned by the Umpelby Family. Mr Charlie Umpelby has in his possession, deeds written on sheepskin which go back to 1624 and a stone plaque over the door shows Spruity Hall Farm to have been built in 1620. The Umpelby family have owned Spruisty for over 100 years, originally being rented and later bought by Mr. Charlie Umpelby's father. All the corn grown on Spruisty was sent to Knox Mill for grinding but later a nill was bought and all grinding done on the farm. They are now dairy farms supporting five families.
